At a toy store, a family bought 3 toy cars, \(c\), and 2 teddy bears, \(b\), for $46. Later that month, another family bought 7 of the same toy cars, \(c\), and 2 of the same teddy bears, \(b\), for $70. The system represents the situation:

\(\left\{\begin{array}{l}3c+2b=46\\\;7c+2b=70\end{array}\right.\)
